goals.question: What is the distribution of movie ratings?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of movie ratings and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between movie budget and revenue?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between movie budget and revenue, and determine if higher budgets lead to higher revenues.

goals.question: What is the most common genre of movies in the dataset?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of the count of each genre in the 'genres' field
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most popular genre of movies in the dataset and understand the distribution of genres.

goals.question: What is the distribution of movie runtimes?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of movie runtimes and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of movie release years?
goals.visualization: Line chart of the count of movies released per year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of movie release years and identify any trends over time.

code:
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='rating', bins=20)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie ratings?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='budget', y='revenue')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between movie budget and revenue?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    genre_counts = data['genres'].explode().value_counts()
    sns.barplot(x=genre_counts.index, y=genre_counts.values)
    
    plt.title("What is the most common genre of movies in the dataset?", wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel("Genres")
    plt.ylabel("Count")
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='runtime', bins=20)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie runtimes?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['release_year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['release_date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='ignore').dt.year
    yearly_counts = data['release_year'].value_counts().sort_index()
    
    sns.lineplot(x=yearly_counts.index, y=yearly_counts.values)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of movie release years?', wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
